properties.name: Bridge at Bear Creek and Parsons
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarBear Creek and ParsonsSeems to me that as busy as Gst is and as bad as traffic is in this town if there was a bridge at parsons over Bear Creek and finish the road thru to Yosemite parkway that would clear a lot of traffic off of Gst. Almost everyone north of bear creek and east of Gst has to go down Gst to get to the south part of town. Build a bridge and atleast half of the people would be able to use that route.... Sound Reasonable? Rick 209-233-1248 emale-4u@pacbell.net

properties.name: City built ramp to catch air in your car
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarWhen goin westward on Yosemite ave from Mst towards 59, if you\'re doing the speed limit or so, 40-45 mph, there is a good chance you\'ll find you car or motorcycle with 1, 2 or 4 wheels off the ground when crossing the yosemite/R st intersection. My car regularly flies through the air at 40 mph at that intersection in the right hand lane.

properties.description: Posted by Mercedsunstarintersection at Motel Dr & yosmitee parkway at Carrows.

properties.name: Dos Palos, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarSeptember 2005: Sheriff deputies discover 2,000 plants on the south bank of the San Joaquin River, 10 miles north of Dos Palos.Two men who had walked into the garden were shot by armed guards who were able to escape law enforcement.

properties.name: Dos Palos, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarSeptember 2003: 3,000 plants worth 8 million discovered by sheriff’s deputies on a plantation near Erreca Slough.

properties.name: FIX THIS INTERSECTION!
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarThis intersection is horrible. No one going westward knows if they should use their turn signals or not. Those who shouldn\'t because they\'re going straight still get confused and use their turn signal. Horrible little intersection! Even worst when semi trucks come through that goofball intersection

properties.name: Hopeton, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarAugust 2004: 3,000 plants discovered by Sheriff’s deputies on the 2500 block of Turlock Road.

properties.name: Hopeton, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarSeptember 2006: 700 plants discovered along Dry Creek and the Merced River by federal, state and local law enforcement agents.

properties.name: Le Grand, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJuly 2007: 1,500 plants discovered in a cornfield by the Merced Multi-Agency Narcotics Task Force.

properties.name: Los Banos, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarOctober 2003: More than 1,000 plants found in home on Columbus Drive. One person is arrested. A sign which read “Welcome To Our Garden” was posted in front of the home.

properties.name: Los Banos, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarDecember 2003: A family of three is arrested for cultivating 550 plants inside their home on the 2600 block of Snowgoose Drive.

properties.name: Los Banos, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarAugust 2004: Sheriff’s deputies discover more than 3,500 plants in an 11.5 acre garden below La Veaga Peak.

properties.name: Merced, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarNovember 2004: Officers with the sheriff’s STAR team and state Department of Justice discover a drug factory on the 2600 block of Lingard Road with thousands of pounds in processed marijuana, rock cocaine and methamphetamine, along with several assault rifles. About 40 people who were working inside the structure tried to flee as officers raided the area.

properties.name: Mucky drainage pond
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarAn anonymous caller says a drainage pond at Parsons and Gerard is plugged. "I noticed that there is another pond next to it, and it is bone dry with dry brown grass inside the whole thing."

properties.name: Old CHP station is ugly, full of weeds
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarThe old CHP station on Parsons Avenue near Highway 99. A reader sent an e-mail today describing it as an eyesore that\'s rundown and full of weeds.

properties.name: Olive ave 4 lanes to Parsons
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarOlive ave needs to be 4 lanes at least to Parsons or even better all the way to McKee. Taking 4 lanes of traffic and try to squeeze them into 2 lanes west of G st. makes it very difficult to get across on the side streets, especially at Gary and Oleander and Christian life center area. Olive drops to only 2 lanes just west of that area, which creates a heavy stream of traffic. 4 lanes would break that up a little.

properties.name: Overgrown tree blocks view of stop sign
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarA tree at Bancroft and Barclay is blocking the view of a stop sign and some are worried an accident is going to happen if it isn\'t trimmed.

properties.name: Planada, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJuly 2007: More than 19,000 plants discovered in a 100-acre cornfield by the Merced Multi-Agency Narcotics Task Force. Officers said the operation, valued at 6 million, was one of the most sophisticated they had ever seen, as the marijuana plants were strategically positioned beside each corn stalk.

properties.name: San Luis Reservoir
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJune 2004: Horse mounted Sheriff’s deputies discover 3,100 immature plants in a wooded canyon southwest of San Luis Reservoir. A small campsite discovered next to the garden, with two sleeping bags and ammunition for a .22 caliber gun.

properties.name: Snelling, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJuly 28, 2005: 1,589 plants discovered along the Merced River by Stanislaus County Sheriff’s Department officers, who spotted the plants from the air.

properties.name: Snelling, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJuly 2004: Nearly 2,000 plants discovered by Sheriff’s deputies near Highway 59. One suspect arrested.

properties.name: Snelling, CA
properties.description: Posted by Mercedsunstar

properties.name: Snelling, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarJanuary 2003: 46 pounds of marijuana worth 2,000 discovered by the Merced-Mariposa Narcotics Task Force in a house on Los Cerritos Road. Three people are arrested.

properties.name: Snelling, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarAugust 2006: Sheriff’s deputies find 645 marijuana plants — some reaching heights of 14 feet. “They reminded me of mulberry trees,” said Sgt. Vern Warnke of the Sheriff’s Tactical and Reconnaissance Team (STAR).

properties.name: Stevinson, CA
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarMay 2006: Merced Multi-Agency Narcotics Task Force officers seize 13,400 plants worth million. Four people in Clovis and Fresno are later arrested.

properties.name: Tall dry weeds creating a fire hazard
properties.description: Posted by Mercedsunstar Tall dry weeds between homes and the railroad tracks near Santa Fe Avenue are just waiting for a discarded cigarette to light them up.

properties.name: West st. Extension
properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarWest st. and ChildsExtend West St down to Dickenson Ferry and that would make an easier route for traffic to and from Hwy 59 South and the airport and Industrial park area. They wouldnt have to drive down childs thru the school zone and residential areas. The road would just have to run from its present end along side the airport runway till it reaches Dickenson Ferry. Rick 209-384-1731 emale-4u@pacbell.net

properties.description: Posted by MercedsunstarFebruary 2003: 589 plants worth up to .9 million found by Merced-Mariposa Narcotic Task Force agents at a residence on the 6800 block of Ruby Court. Three men are arrested.
